Commercetools Sunrise Styleguide

  • 1.2Sizing

1 Buttons

Buttons are important stuff to make things happens But the buttons are also stuffed

1.1 Base styles & states

Markup

<button type="submit" class="sr-btn [modifier class]">Button</button>
<button type="submit" class="sr-btn sr-btn--primary [modifier class]">Button</button>
<button type="submit" class="sr-btn sr-btn--secondary [modifier class]">Button</button>
<button type="submit" class="sr-btn sr-btn--inverted [modifier class]">Button</button>
:hover
Hover state.
:active
Active state.
.sr-btn--disabled
Disabled button. If you use <button> element, that is acceptable to add disabled attribute instead.

1.2 Sizing

Fancy larger or smaller buttons? Add some modifier class

Markup

<button class="sr-btn [modifier class]">Button</button>
<button class="sr-btn sr-btn--primary [modifier class]">Button</button>
<button class="sr-btn sr-btn--secondary [modifier class]">Button</button>
<button class="sr-btn sr-btn--inverted [modifier class]">Button</button>
.sr-btn--large
Large button.
.sr-btn--small
Small button.
.sr-btn--mini
Mini button.
.sr-btn--block
Block level button.
Created using kss-node and kss-node-template.
